column7: London: US Summer Associate Programme – London (2028 Entry) Exceed Your Own Expectations with A&O Shearman Join one of the world’s leading financial centres as a Summer Associate in London and become a fully integrated member of our diverse, vibrant, and award-winning team. Our US Corporate Finance group is consistently ranked Tier 1 across debt, equity, and high yield transactions. We are seeking individuals who demonstrate outstanding academic achievement, initiative, and a genuine desire to take on responsibility from day one. What We Offer • Career Launch in US Law: Our London-based summer programme is the ideal starting point for a career in US law, with the prospect of joining A&O Shearman in a full-time, entry-level role in 2027. • Comprehensive Work Experience: Over a 10-week programme, you will participate in training sessions led by our partners, gaining insight into the key elements of US Corporate Finance. You will work as a junior associate on high-profile matters and enjoy weekly social events to help you connect with your colleagues and experience London. • Professional Growth and Development: We are committed to your ongoing development, offering structured training, mentoring, and practical support. You will have access to dedicated mentors and points of contact to ensure you receive the best possible guidance and pastoral care. • Supportive and Inclusive Team: From your first day, you will work closely with partners and associates, taking on early responsibility and developing client relationship skills. You will also have opportunities to contribute to international pro bono work and local community initiatives. • Global Practice and Client Variety: A&O Shearman boasts one of the most sophisticated US practices outside the United States, advising on all US aspects of international capital markets transactions. You will work with a diverse range of clients, including multinational corporations, financial institutions, and governments, on their most complex legal challenges. • International Network: With more than 40 offices worldwide, you will build unrivalled international connections and benefit from the broadest global network among leading law firms. • Competitive Salary and Relocation Support: In addition to professional development, you will receive a competitive salary and support with global mobility and relocation. Who Should Apply We are looking for candidates who: • Candidates looking for a 2L summer position • Demonstrate exceptional academic achievement (JD or equivalent in progress) • Show initiative, drive, and a willingness to take on responsibility • Have a keen interest in practising US law in London • Are eager to work in a collaborative, international environment Application Process • First Round Interview: Successful applicants will be invited to a 20-minute virtual interview with a partner from our US Corporate Finance group. • Second Round Interviews: Successful candidates will be invited to two further virtual interviews (30 minutes each), each conducted by a partner and an associate. In addition, candidates will have the opportunity to participate in a 30-minute Q&A session with a junior associate from the team. This session is designed to help you learn more about the opportunity and the nature of the work undertaken by the team, providing valuable insight to inform your decision-making. • Programme Offers: Candidates who successfully complete the interview process will be offered a place in our 2027 London Summer Associate Programme. Applications will open in early 2026. Contact Us If you have questions about the application process, please feel free to contact us at uscfrecruitment@aoshearman.com. Start your journey with A&O Shearman and shape your future in US law, right here in London.  NY: 2027 Summer Associate Introducing A&O Shearman. We’ve arrived and we’re ready for anything anywhere. With nearly 4,000 lawyers globally, we are equally fluent in English law, U.S. law and the laws of the world’s most dynamic markets. We are now accepting applications for our 2027 U.S. Summer Associate Program. Length: 10 weeks How is work assigned? Summer associates in our New York and Washington, DC offices will participate in our RotationPlus system. RotationPlus combines the best elements of both legacy firms’ assigning models. Summer associates will participate in two five-week practice group rotations. To provide flexibility in exploring practice group interests and customization of the summer associate experience, the Law School Recruitment team will maintain a centralized assignment database that will enable summer associates to explore work outside of their two assigned practice groups. Summer associates can expect to have multiple substantive and social touchpoints with their partner and associate mentors each week. What opportunities for mentorship are available? Each summer associate is paired with a senior mentor (either a partner or counsel) and an associate mentor. Mentors help integrate summer associates into the firm, both substantively and socially. Each of our summer associate also participates in a weekly peer mentoring circle. There are unlimited opportunities for informal mentorship through the many relationships you will form with our lawyers across practice groups during the summer. What opportunities for professional development are available? Our Professional Development team coordinates comprehensive programs as part of Summer Associate University (SAU). Topics include Writing, Negotiations, Professionalism, Research, Inclusion, Wellness, Law Firm Economics and more. Are there opportunities to split between offices? Internationally, summer associates have split between New York/London, New York/Tokyo, and the Bay Area/Tokyo. Within the U.S., summers may split between New York/DC and Texas/NY. We plan to expand international opportunities for summer associates in future summer programs, as we recognize the value of international experience in developing well-rounded lawyers who will be working at A&O Shearman. What is the salary? Summer associates are paid $4,327 per week. Hiring Criteria Required: We are looking for strong academic performance, law school involvement, and an enthusiasm about the practice of law. We also remain strongly committed to inclusion and expect that our associates will view collegiality and teamwork as important personal and firm values. Only JD 2028 law students are eligible to apply. Preferred: Relevant work experience; law journal/moot court participation; foreign language skills. To learn more about our summer program, please see our interactive brochure.

Work assignments relate to ongoing client matters, offer practical exposure to the firm's client base and practice and are representative of work given to attorneys at Cooley. All summer associates participate in two and a half days of training and orientation at the annual kickoff weekend at the Seascape Resort in Aptos, California. On the business side, summer associates learn the basics of mergers & acquisitions, venture fund formation and venture capital financings, to name a few. On the litigation side, they attend classes regarding discovery, brief writing and witness interviewing. This may include previous work in these areas and exposure through coursework or research. • A full list of Orrick’s practice groups, and which Business Unit they are affiliated with, can be found here: https://media.orrick.com/Media%20Library/public/files/o/orrick-bu-and-pg-list.pdf • Please indicate in your interview which Business Unit and/or practice area(s) you are interested in. • Candidates should expect to work predominately with the Business Unit they have indicated a primary interest in. • Virtual interviews will begin to take place in November. • Offers will be extended starting in January on a rolling basis. • The application process will remain open until the class is filled. • If you have questions about this opportunity, please contact recruiting@orrick.com As an Orrick Summer Associate, our goal is to provide you with a meaningful and rewarding summer experience. • You will do substantive work, spanning a wide breadth of assignments across Orrick’s varied practices and offices. • You will be provided with opportunities to deepen your understanding of the practice of law through attorney shadowing experiences and participation in both local and national training programs, including workshops on improving your legal writing skills and how to become a more effective speaker. • Our summer program features a variety of unique events and programming designed to foster connections among Summer Associates and Orrick attorneys. These include both local and national social activities. Past events have included courses on making sushi, charcuterie boards, and candles, as well as recreational activities like baseball games, canoeing, sailing, beach cycling, karaoke, Topgolf, bowling, and chocolate tastings. Applicants must be pursuing a JD degree at an ABA-accredited law school with an anticipated graduation date in 2028. Applicants enrolled in part-time JD programs or pursuing dual degrees (e.g., JD/MBA) at an ABA-accredited law school, who are not expected to graduate in 2028, are also eligible to apply. Compensation and Benefits The expected gross salary for this position is $4,326.92/week. Orrick is committed to providing a comprehensive, competitive, and thoughtful total compensation package to our attorneys and staff, wherever they work. This compensation and benefits information is based on the Orrick’s estimate as of the date of publication and may be modified in the future. The level of pay within the range will depend on a variety of job-related factors that may include, but not limited to, qualifications, relevant experience or education, particular skills or expertise, geography. Other compensation may include an annual discretionary merit bonus, which would be determined by Firm and individual performance. We offer a full range of elective health benefits including medical, dental, vision and life; robust mental well-being programs; child, family, elder, and pet care benefits; short- and long-term disability and industry leading parental leave benefits; health savings account contributions (w/applicable medical plan), flexible spending accounts, and a 401K program. This role will receive compensated time off through our Flexible Time Off program and paid holidays.

With a significant presence throughout Asia, Europe, Latin America, and the U.S., we are recognized as one of the world’s most innovative global law firms. Students should be committed to working for a dynamic and entrepreneurial law firm on complex legal matters across practices and offices to help our clients overcome challenges and find innovative solutions to move their business forward. Law students with outstanding academic credentials, superior writing skills, Law Review, Journal, or Moot Court membership are preferred.

About Sterne Kessler: Sterne, Kessler, Goldstein & Fox is one of the most highly regarded intellectual property specialty law firms dedicated to the protection, transfer and enforcement of IP rights for its clients. Based in Washington, D.C., we are a full-service IP firm offering patent litigation, patent preparation and prosecution of design and utility patents, and trademark and brand protection. Our firm culture is what sets us apart in the industry. It is the talent and dynamism of each individual that contributes to our shared success. We have cultivated an environment that is welcoming, inclusive, and intellectually stimulating with just the right touch of fun and exuberance. We will review and consider applications from students enrolled in an ABA-accredited law school juris doctor program expecting to graduate in May 2028 for our 2026 and 2027 Summer Programs. Please apply to each practice group for which you would like to be considered. What to Expect: •        The 2026 Summer Program will be held in-person in our Washington, DC office from May 18 – July 24, 2026. •        The 2027 Summer Program will be held in-person in our Washington, DC office from May 24 – July 30, 2027. •        Summer associates may work-from-home 1-2 days per week. •        Summer Associates are compensated at a rate of $4,326/week. •        Our summer associates work on matters involving cutting-edge technologies developed by a broad range of innovative individuals and companies. •        Your summer will include relevant work assignments, an informal mid-point and formal end-of-summer evaluation, workshops/trainings, and exposure to our team structure, all designed to reflect what life is like for an attorney at Sterne Kessler. •        Our summers enjoy a number of social events, which allow summer associates to get to know our attorneys on a personal level. Past events have included our firm-wide crab feast, our firm-wide night at the Nationals, other DC sporting events, cooking classes, city and museum tours, and more. Electronics Group: Requires a degree in Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent discipline. Mechanical & Design Group: Requires a degree in Aerospace Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Material Science or Physics, or an equivalent discipline. A STEM undergraduate or advanced degree is preferred, but not required. Patent bar eligibility preferred, but not required.
